data.scheme_name: IT and ITeS Policy of Uttar Pradesh 2022 - Non - Fiscal Incentives - NYI
data.benefits: Exemptions from compliances like certifications and Inspection under various Act.
data.eligibility: New units with a minimum Fixed Capital Investment (FCI) of Rs 200 lakhs are elgible under the scheme.
data.conditions: Incentives will be provided to those IT/ITeS Companies who will set up their operations in Uttar Pradesh.
data.beneficiaries: New units with a minimum Fixed Capital Investment (FCI) of Rs 200 lakhs are elgible under the scheme.
data.prerequisites: Incentives will be provided to those IT/ITeS Companies who will set up their operations in Uttar Pradesh.
data.context: The Uttar Pradesh government is transforming itself into a digitally empowered society and knowledge economy, thereby paving its way to become a dream destination for investments in line with its goal to become a $1 trillion economy by 2027.
data.objective: The policy aims to build a robust ecosystem for the sector by enabling a sound business environment and by encouraging collaboration and consolidation towards creating a technological shift in the state through establishment of IT Cities, IT Parks and Centers of Excellence in emerging technologies such as AI, Blockchain, Big data, Cloud computing and IoT.
data.description: Exemption from UP Pollution Control Act: IT/ITeS industries are exempt, except for power generation sets with a capacity greater than 25 KVA.Exemption from Inspections:Exempt from inspections under the following acts and rules, except when specific complaints arise. Inspections are permitted once every five years:The Factories ActThe Maternity Benefit ActThe Shops & Establishments ActThe Contract Labour (Regulation & Abolition) ActThe Payment of Wages ActThe Minimum Wages ActThe Employment Exchanges (Compulsory Notification of Vacancies) ActSelf-Certifications: IT/ITeS units can file self-certifications in prescribed formats for the above acts (which may be amended occasionally).24x7 Operations: IT/ITeS companies are allowed to operate 24x7 in three shifts, with the employment of women in all shifts.Essential Services: The State Government may notify certain IT/ITeS units as "essential services" or public utility services when necessary.Floor Area Ratio (FAR): FAR of 3 and 1 (purchasable as per prevailing building bylaws) is applicable to IT/ITeS units.Applicability: These non-fiscal incentives apply to both new and expanding IT/ITeS units.
data.how_to_apply: The Applicant can apply through Integrated Single Window Platform for IT & and ITES under one roof for time - bound clearances:http://itpolicyup.gov.in/application - forms - iip - registration - form/
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get incentive after approval of the application by the concerned authority.
